subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: Kelly Pavlik dominated Marco Antonio Rubio from the start in a middleweight bout Saturday night, emphatically rebounding from his first career loss by stopping Rubio after the ninth round before a raucous hometown crowd in Youngstown, Ohio. It was the second time Pavlik (35-1, 31 knockouts) had fought in his hometown since 2001, long before he stunned Jermain Taylor to win the World Boxing Council and World Boxing Organization titles.
